newsitem.title: CHINA: China Railway Ministry to launch 3.5 bln yuan bond.
newsitem.headline: China Railway Ministry to launch 3.5 bln yuan bond.

text.p: China's Ministry of Railways is to launch a 3.5 billion yuan ($421 million) corporate bond issue next week, the China Daily said on Thursday.

The railway bonds will be for three and five-year terms and carry interest rates of 11-12 percent, it said, quoting an official with lead underwriter Huaxia Securities. It gave no further details. The rates compare with 8.28 percent on three-year fixed deposits and 9.0 percent for five-year deposits.
Next week's issue would kick off plans to issue 15 billion yuan worth of corporate bonds this year, the China Daily said.

An official with Guotai Securities, manager of a planned power bond issue, said issuers were hastening to launch their bonds early in the year to avoid competition from the year's first batch of state debt that could be issued this month.

This year's major issuers include China National Petrochemical Corp, which will issue 1.34 billion yuan, the Ministry of Electronics Industry, which will issue one billion yuan, and the China Yangtze Three Gorges Development Corp, which will debut in the domestic capital markets with an issue valued at one billion yuan, the newspaper said.
Last year, Chinese enterprises issued $13 billion yuan in corporate bonds.
